info.description:
The connectAPI for accommodations defines a service API that lets users search for, 
view, book, and cancel accommodations via TripBuilder.

Key Features:

1. **Get List of Accommodations**: Retrieves a list of all available accommodations, 
    including basic details like code, room description, and price.
2. **Get Accommodation Details**: Provides detailed information about a specific 
    accommodation using its reference.
3. **Check Accommodation Availability**: Shows the current availability status of 
    an accommodation along with its description.
4. **Book an Accommodation**: Allows users to book an accommodation offer using its 
    reference and user details.
5. **Cancel Booking**: Enables users to cancel a booking using its booking reference.

This API is designed to be RESTful, using standard HTTP methods like
GET, POST, and DELETE, and it primarily exchanges data in JSON format.

### Change History

| API Version | Docs Version | Changes                                                                                                                     |
|-------------|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1.0         | 31.07.2023   | Initial version                                                                                                             |
| 1.1         | 05.06.2024   | Extended spec to support Book and Cancel actions                                                                            |
| 1.2         | 04.10.2024   | Extended spec to split offer between search and details offer.                                                              |
|             |              | Added support for available board codes and cancellation policies in search offer model.                                    |
|             |              | Removed deprecated location field from search and details offer                                                             |

### Authentication
All API requests must be made over HTTPS.
info.title: Connect API for Accommodations

get.description:
This endpoint, often known as a "health check" endpoint, is used for
monitoring and assessing the status of the service. Its main function
is to signal the health of the service, aiding in identifying any
potential issues or service breakdowns.

TripBuilder will periodically call this endpoint to check the
service's status. The response from this health check endpoint is used
to assess the current condition of the service. If the service is
operating correctly, the endpoint will return a positive
acknowledgment, i.e. a HTTP 200 status code and a message indicating
the service's health.

On the other hand, if the service is not functioning as expected, the
endpoint will return an error status code and potentially additional
data about the issue's nature.

This proactive health check allows for prompt detection and
resolution of issues, ensuring the service's reliability and smooth
functioning.

parameters.description:
For tracking and debugging, we will include a tracing header with every request. This
trace ID follows the W3C Trace Context standard. Users can see this same header in the
Trip Builder API responses and match it with data in the Supplier system if needed.
parameters.name: traceparent

post.description:
This API uses POST instead of GET for some read operations.
This is due to the complexity and size of some queries.

In HTTP/1.1, GET is typically used for data retrieval. It
should be safe and idempotent, causing no side effects.
However, GET has limitations with complex queries or
large data. For instance, some servers or browsers limit
the maximum URL length for GET requests.

POST requests carry their data in the body of the request.
This allows for larger and more complex data to be sent.
This is useful when the data volume or complexity of
query parameters exceeds GET limitations.

In this API, POST is used for some read operations to
overcome these GET limitations. This allows handling
of complex queries and large data effectively,
ensuring reliable and efficient API operation.

post.description:
When the users selects an offer, or before Tripbuilder books an offer, we check
availability. This ensures that the offer is still available at the same price
with the same amenities and room types. The offer reference provided by the
integration partner must contain all the information needed to uniquely
identify the offer and subsequent booking.

When the users selects an offer, or before Tripbuilder books an offer, we check
availability. This ensures that the offer is still available at the same price
with the same amenities and room types. The offer reference provided by the

parameters.description:
For tracking and debugging, we will include a tracing header with every request. This
trace ID follows the W3C Trace Context standard. Users can see this same header in the
Trip Builder API responses and match it with data in the Supplier system if needed.
parameters.name: traceparent

parameters.description:
An identifier of the contract to differentiate configuration, options or settings.
No other configuration parameter will be supplied by Nezasa.
parameters.name: Contract-Id

parameters.description:
The reference allows the integration partner to uniquely identify the offer.
It is limited to 2000 characters. 
Note that TripBuilder does not parse or interpret the booking reference. The integration
partner can encode necessary information within the reference to facilitate the booking
operation while maintaining a stateless approach.
Customers can plan their trip in advance and book the accommodation later. Therefore,
if the offer is still valid, the reference must retain its validity until the booking
takes place.
Because it is in path of the URL, the reference may be URL-encoded.
parameters.name: reference

400.description: Bad Request. The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

404.description: Not Found. The requested resource could not be found.

500.description: Internal Server Error. An unexpected condition was encountered.

post.summary: [Deprecated] Check availability of accommodation offer before booking.

delete.description:
Cancels a reservation for a given booking reference. The booking reference is
returned by the book response. The integration partner must use this reference to
uniquely identify and cancel the booking. If the booking consists of more that one
room, the integration partner must cancel each room individually.

post.description:
Books an offer in the supplier system. If the offer includes more than one room and
the supplier system does not support multi-room bookings, TripBuilder expects the
integration partner to book multiple rooms. This means the integration partner must
manage errors themselves.

BadRequest.description: Bad Request. The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

NotFound.description: Not Found. The requested resource could not be found.

InternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error. An unexpected condition was encountered.

message.description:
A human-readable problem description in English. Maybe be shown to the end user of 
the system. An actionable message whenever possible. Doesn't contain credentials 
and other secrets.
message.example: Customer phone number must start with a country code prefix, e.g +41.

code.description: Identifies the error type. Snake case (using underscores).

rawRequests.description:
A list of unprocessed requests to the supplier system. If no external system is
involved, the list will be empty. The list is sorted by request time, and any
sensitive information, such as credentials, is redacted.

rawResponses.description:
A list of unprocessed responses from the supplier system. If no external system is
involved, the list will be empty. The list is sorted by request time, and any
sensitive information, such as credentials, is redacted.

AccommodationOffersRequest.description:
Request to search for accommodations based on the given criteria.
Mandatory criteria are the travel period, the room allocation and the accommodation codes.
Additionally can also support filtering by board codes, on request and non-refundable offers.

accommodationCodes.description: Required accommodation codes in one of the formats supported by Nezasa.

boardCodes.description: Required Nezasa board codes. For possible values, see AccommodationRoom in AccommodationOffer. No filtering will be applied if left empty.

onRequest.description: Whether to return on request offers in the response

nonRefundable.description: Whether to return non-refundable offers in the response

market.description: Market country or point-of-sale. 2 letters code of the country (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

purchaseChannel.description: Channel (in supplier-specific format) via which the content is offered

AccommodationOffersRequest.title: Request for accommodations

AccommodationOffersResponse.description: Response providing a list of accommodation offers.

offers.description:
List of accommodation offers for the request accommodation codes. Not an exhaustive list of offers of accommodations.
When possible, returns the cheapest offer per every of accommodation code and offer cancellation type. Otherwise, returns the cheapest offer per
accommodation code, understanding that the customer won't necessarily see the accommodation offer if they look for offers with a particular cancellation
type.
offers.title: List of accommodation offers.

AccommodationCancelRequest.title: Cancel accommodation

rawRequests.description:
A list of unprocessed requests to the supplier system. If no external system is
involved, the list is empty. The list is sorted by request time, and any
sensitive information, such as credentials, is redacted.

rawResponses.description:
A list of unprocessed responses from the supplier system. If no external system is
involved, the list is empty. The list is sorted by request time, and any
sensitive information, such as credentials, is redacted.

total.description:
Total number of results
Can be ignored in requests, the response always give back this information

pageSize.description:
Number of results per page
If the parameter is not specified, the pageSize is the total number of results

resultsFrom.description:
Position (zero based) of the first result to retrieve
If the parameter is not specified, the value is 0

startDate.description: Desired starting date of the product represented in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd)

startTime.description:
Desired starting zoned date/time of the product in ISO8601 format (HH:mm:ss.SSS).
Empty if the activity doesn't have a specific start time (e.g. full day).

endDate.description:
Desired ending date of the product represented in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd)
Empty if the activity doesn't have a specific end time (e.g. full day).

endTime.description: Desired ending zoned date/time of the product in ISO8601 format (HH:mm:ss.SSS).

nights.description: Duration in nights of the product

RoomAllocation.description: Represents the association between a room reference and a list of paxes.

reference.description:
The pax allocation reference (index 1 based reference) as defined in the 
AccommodationRoom object.
reference.title: Pax allocation reference

RoomAllocation.title: Pax allocation in an accommodation

AccommodationSearchOffer.description:
Representation of an accommodation offer.
Can be used to return the cheapest offer for an accommodation with additional information about available cancellation policies and board codes.

remarks.text: Check-in time at 15:00. Check-out time at 11:00.
Check-in time at 15:00. Check-out time at 11:00.

reference.description:
The `reference` allows the integration partner to uniquely identify the offer.
Note that TripBuilder does not parse or interpret the booking reference.
The integration partner can encode necessary information within the reference
to facilitate the booking operation while maintaining a stateless approach.
Note that customers can plan their trip in advance and book the accommodation 
later. Therefore, if the offer is still valid, the `reference` must retain 
its validity until the booking takes place.
reference.title: Offer reference

accommodationCode.description: Accommodation code as requested, in one of the formats supported by Nezasa.
accommodationCode.title: Accommodation code

supplier.description:
The name or a short identification of a specific supplier that provided the offer. Necessary for the means of offer source identification and
filtering. String, not an enum, for quicker enablement.

Trip Builder offers configuration referencing suppliers and sometimes enables supplier-specific content. Therefore, please use identifiers already
present in the system, or consult Nezasa for new suppliers. The list of present suppliers:

Amadeus, Anixe, AOT, AtCore, ATI, Bonotel, CMI, Diethelm, Eurotours, Expedia, ExpediaRapid, GetARoom, Hotelbeds, Jonview, Juniper, Limatours, MTSGlobe,
NWT, Peakwork, PhoenixUnlimited, Priceline, Ratehawk, Restel, STC, Sunhotels, TBO, TourVest, TourVestPush, Travolutionary, W2M, Welcomebeds, YouTravel
supplier.title: Offer supplier

rooms.description: The room and paxes associated with the offer
rooms.title: Offer rooms

onRequest.description: Whether the offer is on request
onRequest.title: Offer on request

remarks.description: Provide remarks returned by the supplier system.
remarks.title: Offer Remarks

availableCancellationPolicies.description:
List of available cancellation policies for an hotel.
When only the cheapest offer is returned for an hotel, this list should contain the complete set of available cancellation policies.
availableCancellationPolicies.title: Available cancellation policies

availableBoardCodes.description:
List of available board codes for for an hotel.
When only the cheapest offer is returned for an hotel, this list should contain the complete set of available board codes.
availableBoardCodes.title: Available board codes

ContactElectronicContactDetails.description: Electronic contacts like phone, email, and website

ContactPhone.description: Phone contact like mobile, landline, fax

GeoAddress.description: Basic representation of a physical address.

street2.description: street address, second line if needed

countryCode.description: 2 letters code of the country (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

itineraryId.description: ID of the planned trip. Will be the same for all bookings made for this trip.
itineraryId.title: Nezasa ID of the itinerary.

agencyId.description: Customer has an option in Trip Builder to configure Supplier specific Agency ID. If configured, the ID is provided here.
agencyId.title: Supplier specific Agency ID.

remarks.text: Check-in time at 15:00. Check-out time at 11:00.
Check-in time at 15:00. Check-out time at 11:00.

bookingReference.description:
The booking reference returned by the book response. This reference allows the
integration partner to uniquely identify the booking. It is limited to 2000 characters. Note that
TripBuilder does not parse or interpret the booking reference.
The integration partner can encode necessary information within the reference to
facilitate booking cancellation while maintaining a stateless approach.
bookingReference.title: Booking reference

supplierReferences.description:
Supplier booking Ids.
- For suppliers where multiple bookings are required to fulfil the booking (one per
room for example) we will end up with multiple supplier ids/references
- This list will contain references for all the booking references, ordered by the
room index (1st room  1st reference)

This is useful if end customer wants to check a particular booking in B2B system
supplierReferences.title: Supplier references

remarks.description: Hotel reservation details as provided by end supplier.
remarks.title: Booking Remarks

BookingStatus.description:
- Booked: Booking was confirmed.
- OnRequest: Booking was confirmed "on request". 
  Only offers that have the onRequest flag set to 
  true can be booked on request.
BookingStatus.title: Represents booking status on the supplier side

age.description: age of the pax at the beginning of the TravelPeriod

nationality.description: 2 letters code of the country (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

nezasaRefId.description: an optional identifier of the pax used for correlation

supplierRefId.description: an optional supplier identifier of the pax

isMainContact.description: if this pax is the main contact

birthDate.description: This date is parsed / serialized through DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE
birthDate.title: The birth date of the pax

secondOrAdditionalNames.description: additional names beside first and last names

CommonPaxTitle.description:
- MR: Mister
- MRS: Mistress or Missus
- MS: Miss
- MSTR: Master, typically used for young boys
- DR: Doctor
- PROF: Professor
- REV: Reverend
- CAPT: Captain
- SIR: Sir
- LADY: Lady
- INF: Infant (0-2 years old)
- CHD: Child (2-11 years old)

boardCode.description:
Nezasa supports the following board codes:

| Code      | Description                             |
|-----------|-----------------------------------------|
| RO        | No Meals                                |
| SC        | Self Catering                           |
| AB        | American Breakfast                      |
| BB        | Breakfast                               |
| CB        | Continental Breakfast                   |
| DB        | Buffet Breakfast                        |
| EB        | English Breakfast                       |
| IB        | Irish Breakfast                         |
| LB        | Light Breakfast                         |
| SB        | Scottish Breakfast                      |
| HB        | Half board                              |
| BH        | Breakfast + Half board                  |
| HBP       | Half board plus                         |
| FB        | Full board                              |
| FH        | Half board + Full board                 |
| FBP       | Full board plus                         |
| AI        | All inclusive                           |
| AIP       | All inclusive plus                      |
| AIPP      | All inclusive double plus               |
| AILight   | All inclusive - drinks only during meals|
| AIPremium | All inclusive plus premium services     |
| AIUltra   | All inclusive plus ultra services       |
| AP        | According to Program                    |
| DC        | Dining credit included                  |
| DO        | Dinner Only                             |
| LO        | Lunch Only                              |
boardCode.title: Nezasa board code

AccommodationSurcharge.title: Accommodation surcharge

AccommodationCancellationPolicy.description: Note that TripBuilder will use the cancellationPolicy if set.
AccommodationCancellationPolicy.title: The cancellation policy of the accommodation

AccommodationCancellationPolicyRule.description:
A cancellation policy rule.
startDatetime and endDatetime define an interval where this rule applies.
Rules don't overlap and cover the whole period from now until the rental itself.
startDatetime is empty whenever the interval starts at now.
endDatetime is empty whenever the interval lasts until the rental itself.
Either percentage or amount needs to be provided.

startDatetime.description:
The start date time of the cancellation policy rule.
This date is parsed / serialized through DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME (As defined by rfc3339).
The field is empty if and only if the interval starts at now.

endDatetime.description:
The end date time of the cancellation policy rule
This date is parsed / serialized through DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME (As defined by rfc3339).
The field is empty if and only if the interval lasts until the rental itself.

AccommodationCancellationPolicyRule.title: A cancellation policy rule of the accommodation

AccommodationRemark.description: Extra information about the accommodation, like check-in and check-out times, accommodation information and additional costs.

example.text: Check-in time at 15:00. Check-out time at 11:00.

text.description:
Remarks sent by the reservation system. 
They can be plain text or formatted with Markdown.
text.example: Check-in time at 15:00. Check-out time at 11:00.

AccommodationRemark.title: Accommodation remark

locationCode.description: Location code that will depend on the location type
locationCode.title: accommodation location code

CommonCancellationPolicy.description:
Defines the cancellation policy type of a product.
 - Free: The cancellation is free for some time after the booking.
 - FeeApplies: There will be some cancellation fee regardless of when the booking is cancelled.
 - NonRefundable: The cancellation fee is 100% once the offer is booked.

Supplier_specific_extra_information_.description:
Information that was required in the past to build a specific customer integration. 
Those fields are not required.
Supplier_specific_extra_information_.title: Supplier specific extra information.

ApiKeyAuth.description:
API key for technical authentication of Nezasa with the integration partner. 
Issued by the integration partner.
ApiKeyAuth.name: Api-Key
